#text=I 'd had my old bike sitting around the house for a few months , but now that the weather is getting warmer I decided I should probably do something about the flat tire in the front .
#text=I 'd already tried using my bike pump ; it would inflate a little but I could never get it anywhere close to fully inflated .
#text=I know from past experience those fix-a-flat or emergency bike repair kits are pretty worthless .
#text=I think they 're made for the narrow old tires you 'd see on ten-speed street bikes .
#text=I have a mountain bike with large tires and a lot of pressure is needed to keep them inflated .
#text=Since I only live a few blocks from a bicycle repair shop I decided to take the bike there .
#text=I bought it at that shop anyway so I figured they 'd do the service for free , as promised .
#text=I stopped by , they took it in the back , replaced the inner tube of the tire , inflated it , and it was as good as new .
#text=Best of all , they only charged me ten bucks for the tube .
#text=That 's the beauty of local , independently own businesses .
